column4: hi all.  I've upgraded to hardy, but I notice that the drivers for the Point of View (NVIDIA) 7600gt still don't work.  I've tried everything under the sun and still no go.  Any chance of a date for problem solving on this issue?
good luck Bidget, I'm having trouble with an earlier card.

i tried envy and I get the same thing Xcell.  I get a message coming up saying that I have to run in low res, cause their is a problem selecting the driver.  I manually select the 7 series for my 7600GT and still nothing.
i did that in gutsy, but i will try it here.
do you have the sudo command for that off hand for downloading nvid manager?
its in repros, just go to synapt, and in search type (nvidia)
do i need to first enable the NEW drivers to be able to utilise the nvid config you speak of?
cause when i enable them, i have the problem of having to run in low res.
if you have the drivers, install them, but you should still be able to run that yes
thanks, will give it a go.
as i said, rebooting will allow x to figure things out
yeah i rebooted many times for this in the past, but not two times in a row so I will try that now.

(NVIDIA Drivers) good news, got it working.  now heres the long story.  i could not get it working in 7.10 (gutsy) for the life of me.  Couldn't work out why.  I installed hardy, and tried everything I had before.  Now heres the tricky bit.  I have Windows XP, fedora 8 and Ubuntu installed.  When I first did all this I had to alter the file in fedora 8's boot/grub/menu.1st.  I had to add the Ubuntu entry to the fedora boot/grub/menu.1st so that Ub
Big thanks to you man!  Everything is swimming along for me now!  My effects and desktop are coming along like never before!
